body:
Hello Wonderful ‘Bug and ‘Bee Community Members, This is a reminder that the next month will feature a series of webinars on Ladybug + Honeybee given by [Chris Mackey](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/profile/ChrisMackey) and hosted by the [Performance Network](https://vimeo.com/ondemand/performancenetwork). If you have been looking for an opportunity to get into a new part of the software or just want to get updated on the latest developments in a 90-minute presentation, then these webinars are for you. Starting this Thursday at 12:30 EST, the workshops will begin by covering basic Ladybug capabilities and will provide a survey of the latest community resources. Each Thursday, there will be another presentation covering progressively advanced topics. In total there will be 5 workshops, each of which you can register for by clicking below: [1 - Ladybug Climate Analysis - August 25th, 12:30 PM EST](https://attendee.gototraining.com/42b11/register/5625475696780932353)
[2 - Ladybug Facade + Shade Design - September 1st, 12:30 PM EST](https://attendee.gototraining.com/42b11/register/8622465118145017857)
[3 - Honeybee Energy, HVAC + Indoor Comfort Modeling - September 8th...](https://attendee.gototraining.com/42b11/register/7712200332230533890)
[4 - Honeybee Daylight + Electric Light - September 15th, 12:30 PM EST](https://attendee.gototraining.com/42b11/register/4181881800697644290)
[5 - Honeybee THERM + WINDOW - September 22nd, 12:30 PM EST](https://attendee.gototraining.com/42b11/register/6190018842551590146) Notably, workshops 2, 3, 4 and 5 will feature substantial coverage of capabilities that do not currently have tutorial videos. This includes new view analysis and tips and tricks for radiation studies in webinar 2, newly-released HVAC capabilities for webinar 3, electric lighting capabilities with webinar 4, and all of webinar 5 will be brand-new hot-off-the-press development! Hope that you can attend!

replies.body:
Hi Chris,



I thought your first webinar was amazing, very well done! I especially loved the introduction to the tools and their history of development. I am sure that a lot of users will relate to your experiences shared. I know I do.



Looking forward to the next ones!



Kind regards,

Theodore.
